title: Substituting $$t$$
text: We can let $$t=x^3$$ and substitute into the equation. We now have $$g(t)=t^2-7t-8$$. This is a quadratic that we can factor normally.

title: Factoring the Quadratic
text: Using factoring, we can convert $$t^2-7t-8$$ to $$\left(t-8\right) \left(t+1\right)$$. So, our equation is now $$g(t)=\left(t-8\right) \left(t+1\right)$$.

title: Solving for $$t$$
text: We can now solve for $$t$$ by setting the equation equal to $$0$$. $$0=\left(t-8\right) \left(t+1\right)$$. $$t=8, -1$$.

title: Solving for the Intercepts
text: Since we know the values of $$t$$, we can take their cube root to find the values of $$x$$. $$x=2, -1$$. This means our intercepts are $$(2,0)$$ and $$(-1,0)$$.
